result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles J Cotter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Charles J Cotter is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Charles J Cotter was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
AODA and comply.  Submit DNA sample.  Cts. 2,3, & 4 are dismissed.

supervisions.notes: ***CORRECTED** 1-17-17  To show credit that was ordered at sentencing.

superMiscConds.notes: A civil judgment will be entered for all unpaid financial obligations.

supervisions.notes: 4/18/17 ORDER TO AMEND JOC to show 1 year initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision.

records.descr: Corrected Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: Defendant Charles J Cotter in court, in custody with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing recommendations argued.  Defendant made statement to Court.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 3.5 years in prison.  1 year initial confinement, 2.5 years extended supervision. 261 days credit.  A civil judgment will be entered for all unpaid financial obligations.  Defendant is eligible for boot camp and sustance abuse program. 10:13/10:45
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Atty. Ryan Frank requests sentencing hearing be set ASAP. Defendant has 236 days jail credit - fax
Appointed Attorney Ryan Frank
and Revocation Summary filed by Probation Agent Corey Endreas, Portage office
filed by atty Raabe and defendant.
filed by defendant and Atty Raabe

Defendant Charles J Cotter in court, in custody with attorney Adam Raabe.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead guilty to Ct. 1.  Court found guilty.  Jugment was entered.  Cts. 2,3, & 4 are dismissed.  On Ct. 1 Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 2 years.  Conditions of probation include: AODA and comply.  Submit DNA sample.  $518.00 costs.  166 days jail credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 7, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Charles J Cotter in court, in custody with attorney Adam Raabe.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion for return of property.  State does not object to IPod being returned or phone.  State objects to the return of the paper with numbers on it.  Court will sign order granting the return of IPod and phone.  Atty Raabe also motioned to have evidence tested.  State objects.  Argument given by State.  Trial has not been set yet.  State does not send evidence for testing until a trial has been set per lab rules.  Arguments by State and Defense.  Court denied motion to have evidence tested by the crime lab on behalf of the defendant.

Defendant Charles J Cotter in court, in custody, with attorney Adam Raabe.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin, called Lodi Police Chief Scott Klicko, sworn in. Witness identified defendant. Exhibits 1 (certified copy Dane Cty. bond) & 2 (CCAP printout of Dane Cty. 14CF283) presented and moved into evidence. Cross examination by Atty. Raabe. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty entered, jury trial to be set. Case called 10:04 a.m., adjourned 10:11 a.m.
